channel.title: Amphibians
channel.description:
[center][b]Amphibians.[/b][/center] Most amphibians have two distinct phases to their lives.They start off as water-dwellers,then pass through a complete change in their physical form as they are transformed into land-dwellers adults.During this metamorphosis,they slowly change shape,growing legs and replacing their gills with air-breathing lungs. A frog. [img]http://animal-world.com/encyclo/reptiles/amphibians/images/frogs_toads/WhiteLippedTreeFrogWHAF_Ap7AF.jpg[/img] [b]Poisonous frogs.[/b] The tropical forests of Central and South America are home to tiny frogs,barely 5 cm (2 in) long.The skin glands of these colorful creatures produce a poisen so toxic that the indigenous tribes of Colombia use it to coat their arrowheads-heance the name,arrow-poisen frogs. [img]http://media-2.web.britannica.com/eb-media/95/5895-004.jpg[/img] If there is any questions about amphibians,please feel free to comment.
Thank you for your time.

item.title: Amphibians
item.dc:creator: @supernovadelta supernovadelta
item.description:
@supernovadelta wrote:

[center]Amphibians.[/center]
Most amphibians have two distinct phases to their lives.They start off as water-dwellers,then pass through a complete change in their physical form as they are transformed into land-dwellers adults.During this metamorphosis,they slowly change shape,growing legs and replacing their gills with air-breathing lungs.
A frog.

Poisonous frogs.
The tropical forests of Central and South America are home to tiny frogs,barely 5 cm (2 in) long.The skin glands of these colorful creatures produce a poisen so toxic that the indigenous tribes of Colombia use it to coat their arrowheads-heance the name,arrow-poisen frogs.

If there is any questions about amphibians,please feel free to comment.

Thank you for your time.
